iso_selberg_trace.definition: Isomorphic patterns in trace formula equivalences across scales capture structural equivalences in spectral/geodesic hierarchiesâ€”mappings where trace formulas, closed geodesics, and eigenvalue distributions preserve relations invariantly. Core focus: Selberg trace formula for hyperbolic manifolds mirroring explicit formulas for zeta/L-functions, linking length spectra of geodesics to zeros. Validated via category theory (e.g., spectral-geometric functors), arithmetic geometry, and cross-domain analogies (e.g., billiard flows to prime distributions per 2025 hyperbolic chaos models). Hard-to-vary invariants like length-zero correspondence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox resolution (affirm trace identity/deny classical sums/both in quantum-arithmetic transitions/neither in non-hyperbolic gaps); scores >0.98 based on 2025 trace abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from spectral geometry/web and trace overlays (e.g., geodesic lengths to resonance zeros).
Validate coverage across scales; flag arithmetic quantum transfers as speculative (<4% variance bound).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., Arthur-Selberg extensions); integrate diachronic depth (Selberg 1956 to 2025 arithmetic trace refinements).
Export lean JSON; auto-export flagged transfers to Module 0 for ratification.
Yoneda-like embeddings consume regenerative_pool: Map pruned geodesic analogs into higher trace equivalences.
